channel.title: Publishize Your Way to Success Podcast
channel.description: Learn how to expand your business by demonstrating your expertise with print and online information products. The Publishize Podcast explains how you can apply modern technology to publicise your business through publishing.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2008 by Logical Expressions, Inc. All rights reserved.

channel.itunes:subtitle: Learn how to publicize your business through publishing.

item.title: Peer Review and Getting Endorsements
item.description: Do a peer review and ask for testimonials long before your book is even finished.
item.itunes:author: Susan C. Daffron
item.itunes:summary: Do a peer review and ask for testimonials long before your book is even finished.

item.title: The Back Cover of Your Book is Important Too

item.title: Why Your First Book Won't Be Your Last
item.description: Once you write your first book, you'll discover many reasons why you should write more books.
item.itunes:author: James H. Byrd
item.itunes:summary: Once you write your first book, you'll discover many reasons why you should write more books.

item.title: To Market Your Book, You Need to Get Out of the Bubble

item.itunes:summary: If you ever want anyone to read your book, you need to get out there and market it.

item.itunes:summary: Traditional publishers no longer have a monopoly; authors have more options than ever for publishing their books.

item.itunes:summary: If you are pondering short-run digital printing (or POD) no other company has the distribution advantage of Lightning Source.

item.itunes:summary: Procrastination is the enemy of writers and probably the reason most books never see the light of day.

item.itunes:summary: Learn how to use audio to promote your book or to create companion products that complement your book.

item.title: Which Tasks Should Self-Publishers Outsource?

item.itunes:summary: Sometimes the best person for the job is not you, so save your sanity by outsourcing tasks you don't like or aren't good at.
